items.headline: My husband sold his IRA without my knowledge prior to our divorce. Is this legal?

items.headline: Weight-loss drug manufacturer Novo Nordisk cuts 9000 jobs — and its profit forecast
items.summary_en: New CEO Mike Doustdar is kitchen-sinking the costs of restructuring the company to focus on diabetes and anti-obesity drugs.

items.headline: Tesla is losing U.S. market share. And that’s in the middle of an EV boom.
items.summary_en: Has Tesla lost is ‘aura’? Tesla Inc.’s share of the U.S. EV market has fallen to its lowest on record, despite a boom for EV sales in the U.S.

items.headline: Judge rules Lisa Cook can stay at the Fed, for now. She’ll likely vote at this month’s rate-setting meeting.
items.summary_en: A judge has ruled that Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook should stay in her post for the time being, likely preserving her vote at the central bank’s Sept. 16-17 meeting that will set interest rates, and delivering a setback to President Donald Trump’s effort to fire her over an allegation of mortgage fraud.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Oracle’s stock surges toward its best day since 1999. These huge numbers explain why.

items.headline: Klarna prices IPO well above expected range, raising $1.37 billion
items.summary_en: Klarna’s IPO priced at $40 late Tuesday, well above its expected range of $35 to $37.

items.headline: GameStop posts 5th straight quarterly profit, thanks to a big sales jump
items.summary_en: The original meme stock reported a 22% rise in sales and a fifth consecutive profit, sending it nearly 6% higher after hours Tuesday.

items.headline: Trump aims to curb direct-to-consumer ads for drugs. Hims & Hers Health could be targeted.
items.summary_en: President Donald Trump’s administration on Tuesday rolled out an executive action aimed at limiting direct-to-consumer advertising for pharmaceuticals, with officials saying a recent Hims & Hers Health Inc. ad stood out as an example of what should be prevented.
